name: Anathallis minutalis
description: Anathallis minutalis is an epiphytic orchid native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly Costa Rica, Panama, and Colombia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features creeping stems (5-10 cm long) with small, dramatic, lance-shaped, dark green leaves and distinctive tiny flowers. The plant displays a creeping growth habit. Adapted to tropical climates with high humidity, consistent warmth, and filtered light conditions. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant is perfect for small spaces and terrariums. It's popular among orchid enthusiasts for its extremely compact size.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
